data.name: A New Era (Japanese Calendar Conversion)
data.description:
In Japanese tradition, the beginning of the reign of a new emperor marks a new era in the calendar. For example, in 1868 according to the Western calendar, when Emperor Meiji began his reign, the calendar year was known as Meiji 1. 1869 would be Meiji 2, 1870 would be Meiji 3, etc, etc. When Emperor Taisho ascended to the throne in 1912, that year was known as Taisho 1, 1913 was Taisho 2, etc. 

The task in this exercise is to create a function that can recognise its input as either a Japanese calendar year or a Western calendar year, and convert it to its corresponding year in the other system.

For reference:
The Meiji Era was from 1868 - 1911.
The Taisho Era was from 1912 - 1925.
The Showa Era was from 1926 -1989.
The Heisei Era was from 1989 until the present day.

For simplicity the earliest possible date will be 1868, or Meiji 1. 

When a Western calendar year is returned, it must be an integer, and when the Japanese calendar year is returned, it must be a string.

Examples: 

"Showa 5" should return 1930.
1870 should return "Meiji 3".
If the user inputs a incomplete Japanese year, or an empty string, the result should return false.
If the user inputs an invalid number, the result should return false.
